summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Citibank, demanding extensive financial records for accounts and transactions from January 1, 2019 onward. The subpoena is related to an investigation into alleged violations of federal statutes including bribery, conspiracy, false statements, and obstruction. It includes detailed instructions for document production and a reimbursement procedure.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena to Citibank as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands Citibank to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce records, though a personal appearance can be avoided if records are produced by this date.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is dated and issued to Citibank, demanding financial records as part of a federal investigation.

locations: Citibank Legal Service Intake Unit (LSI), One Court Square, 31st Floor, Long Island City, NY 11120
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
U.S. Attorney's Office, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
U.S. Attorney's Office - SDNY Accounts Payable, 86 Chambers Street, 3rd floor, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena targets Citibank for financial records from January 1, 2019 onward, indicating an active federal investigation at that time.

The investigation involves alleged violations of multiple federal statutes: 18 U.S.C. §§ 201 (bribery), 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), 1346 (honest services fraud), 1519 (obstruction), and 2 (aiding and abetting).
The requested records are extensive, covering account documents, statements, wire transfers, credit card records, and customer information for specific accounts and any related accounts.
The subpoena reference number is 2019R01059, and it includes a detailed rider specifying the exact records required and technical instructions for their production.
The document includes a declaration form for a custodian of records to certify the authenticity of the produced business records under penalty of perjury.
